bug.author: justanhduc
bug.summary: [Bug] Mismatched input and output shapes in Augmentations
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: Simply applying to an RGB image would produce the batch version. First discussion was <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/issue_comments/708281134>here</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-code>>>> import torch >>> from kornia.augmentation import ColorJitter >>> x = T.rand(3, 4, 4) >>> cj = ColorJitter(0.2, 0.3, 0.2, 0.3) >>> cj(x).shape torch.Size([1, 3, 4, 4]) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Output should have the same shape as input. <denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Maybe it is the originally intended behavior, but I think it is too rigid and deeply integrated into training deep NN, while the goal of Kornia is a differentiable OpenCV in GPU. Or am I missing anything here? Edit 2: Added link to the original discussion.

comments.comment: Not only ColorJitter. All augmentations were designed to input everything then output BCHW for 2D, BCDHW for 3D. It could be very straightforward if updating the code in _AugmentationBase. Since it gonna change a lot of behaviours, we shall discuss it first. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/edgarriba>@edgarriba</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/FGeri>@FGeri</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ducha-aiki>@ducha-aiki</denchmark-link> What are you guys thinking? Shall we update the code to align the input shape?
I would return always the same shape as the input.
I'd also go for not changing the shape.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/justanhduc>@justanhduc</denchmark-link> Please go-ahead for a PR if you are okay to do so!
Ok I will try to work on it asap.
